document.full_text: in 1983, a civil servant named robert ball worked a political miracle: he convinced republican ronald reagan to raise taxes and democrat tip o'neill to accept trims to social security.
document.title: as boomers age, a soul-searching budget battle
lines_and_colors: in 1983, a civil servant named robert ball worked a political miracle: he convinced republican ronald reagan to raise taxes and democrat tip o'neill to accept trims to social security.
